recipe_name: Mixed berry gratin with basil sabayon
author: James Martin
method: For the sabayon, place a glass bowl over a saucepan of barely simmering water. Add the egg yolks and sugar and whisk continuously, until pale and light. Add the champagne and continue whisking until pale and fluffy. (The foam must be sufficiently thickened so that it won't break down when it cools.) Remove from the heat and cool until tepid. For the berry gratin, place all of the berries and the sugar into a bowl and mix together. Then divide evenly among four ovenproof bowls. Add the basil to the sabayon, mix well, then spoon the sabayon over the berries. Using a mini-blowtorch, heat the top of the sabayon until it turns golden-brown, then serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 free-range egg yolks,  50g/2oz caster sugar,  110ml/3fl oz champagne,  6 fresh basil leaves, finely chopped,  50g/2oz raspberries,  50g/2oz strawberries,  50g/2oz blackberries,  50g/2oz blueberries,  50g/2oz caster sugar
